wikipedia_page.main:
Jack Wiseman (1919 in Brierfield, Lancashire – 1991) was a British economist. He is known for being one of the first professors of economics at the University of York and an early scholar of health economics.
He joined the Territorial Army in 1939 and fought in the Second World War. Wiseman joined the London School of Economics as a student in 1946, where he later became a lecturer in Business and Public Finance. In 1964, Wiseman joined the University of York, where he was founding Director of the Institute of Social and Economic Research (ISER).

response: John Wiseman may also refer to:
*John Wiseman (MP) (by 1515–1558), for East Grinstead and Maldon
